document.docAuthor: Alves, Tayná, Clarkson, Bruno & Lima, Lucas Ramos Costa
document.docTitle: Chasmogenus cajuina Alves & Clarkson & Lima 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Chasmogenus Sharp, 1882 and new records of Hydrophilidae (Coleoptera) from Northeastern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Chasmogenus Sharp, 1882 and new records of Hydrophilidae (Coleoptera) from Northeastern Brazil

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Laboratório de Biodiversidade, Campus Heróis do Jenipapo, Universidade Estadual do Piauí (UESPI)
Laboratório de Biodiversidade Entomológica, Instituto Oswaldo Cruz, Fundação Oswaldo Cruz (Fiocruz)
aboratório de Biodiversidade, Campus Heróis do Jenipapo, Universidade Estadual do Piauí (UESPI)

heading.emphasis:
Chasmogenus cajuina
sp. nov. Alves, Clarkson & Lima

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 1–8. Chasmogenus cajuina sp. nov. 1–3) Habitus: 1, dorsal view; 2, ventral view (2a, detail of last ventrite); 3, lateral view. 4) Head in dorsal view. 5) Head in ventral view and prosternum. 6–8) Aedeagus: 6) ventral view; 7, dorsal view; 8, detail of apical half.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype ( male
): “ Brasil : Piauí , Castelo do Piaui ,/ Cachoeira das Arraias ,/ 5°11’28.5”S , 41°42’03.2”W ,
174m
/
12.III.2016
, Silva, G. R . leg. ( CEHJ 354 )” ( MNRJ )
.
Paratypes (17): Brazil . Piauí State . Castelo do
Piauí Municipality :
Same data as Holotype ( 2 exs. : MNRJ ; 2 exs. : DZUP ; 2 exs. : MZSP ; 2 exs. SEMC );
Alto Longá Municipality : “
Cachoeira da Campeira ,/ 5°11’45.1” 42°15’33.9,
177m
,/
05.IV.2017
, Lima, L. R .C. leg. ( CEHJ 462 )” ( 2 exs. : NMPC ); “ 5°11’45.1”S , 42° 6’47.70”W ,
17.II.2018
, Alves , T .S. leg.” ( 1 ♂ , 1♀ : CE- UFPE );
Novo Santo Antônio Municipality :
“ Cachoeira da Coruja , 5°22’02.6”S , 41°59’52.9”W ,
29.III.2018
, Alves , T .S. leg.” ( 1 ♂ , 1♀ : CE-UFPE );
Piripiri Municipality :
“ Cachoeira do Bota Fora , 4°12’51.1”S , 41°40’01.7”W ,
15.XII.2018
, Alves , T .S. leg.” ( 2 ♂ , 1 ♀ : CE-UFPE ).
Size and form. Total length 3.72 mm ; maximum width 2.12 mm ; maximum width of head 1.05 mm ; elytral length 2.43 mm ; maximum width of pronotum 1.89 mm . Body broadly, oval and moderately convex.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Chasmogenus cajuina
sp. nov.
1–3) Habitus: 1, dorsal view; 2, ventral view (2a, detail of last ventrite); 3, lateral view. 4) Head in dorsal view. 5) Head in ventral view and prosternum. 6–8) Aedeagus: 6) ventral view; 7, dorsal view; 8, detail of apical half.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Body length from 3.35 mm to 4.00 mm. Relevant variation on coloration and sexual dimorphism in the external morphology was not observed in the type specimens.

Etymology. The specific name “
cajuina
” (from Portuguese “cajuína”) is dedicated to the famous cashew-based drink, symbol of the State of Piauí . The name stands as a noun in apposition.

Biology. The type and additional material were collected near flowing water from potamal and ritral sections of streams on backwater margins. The specimens were collected mainly in low altitude regions from
68 to 177 m
.a.s.l., in area of the ecotone between Cerrado and Caatinga ecosystems.
Distribution. Brazil , Piauí State : Municipalities of Alto Longá, Castelo do Piauí , Novo Santo Antônio, and Piripiri.
